title: Authors and Citation
text: Shu Wei Chou-Chen. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. Rodrigo . Oliveira. Author. Gilberto . Paula. Author. Sebastian Sanchez Sandi. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chou-Chen S, Oliveira R, Paula G (2025). aplms: Additive Partial Linear Models Symmetric Autoregressive Errors. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/shuwei325/aplms.
code: @Manual{,   title = {aplms: Additive Partial Linear Models with Symmetric Autoregressive Errors},   author = {Shu Wei Chou-Chen and Rodrigo A. Oliveira and Gilberto A. Paula},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/shuwei325/aplms}, }

what: Additive Partial Linear Models with Symmetric Autoregressive Errors
title: Additive Partial Linear Models with Symmetric Autoregressive Errors
text: goal aplms fitting Additive partial linear models symmetric autoregressive errors (APLMS), proposed Chou-Chen et al., (2024). framework models time series response variable using linear nonlinear structures set explanatory variables, nonparametric components approximated natural cubic splines P-splines. also accounts autoregressive error terms distributions lighter heavier tails normal distribution.

title: Additive Partial Linear Models with Symmetric Autoregressive Errors
text: can install package : development version aplms GitHub :
code: install.packages("aplms") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("shuwei325/aplms")

title: Additive Partial Linear Models with Symmetric Autoregressive Errors
text: details model assumptions given Chou-Chen et al., (2024).

title: Additive Partial Linear Models with Symmetric Autoregressive Errors
text: package provides two datasets illustrate model fitting procedure. load package:
code: library(aplms)

what: 1. Global annual mean surface air temperature
title: Additive Partial Linear Models with Symmetric Autoregressive Errors
text: first dataset temperature:  perform diagnostic influence analyses, execute:
code: data(temperature)  # Create dataframe object to fit the model datos = data.frame(temperature,time=1:length(temperature))  mod1<-aplms::aplms(temperature ~ 1,                    npc=c("time"), basis=c("cr"),Knot=c(60),                    data=datos,family=Powerexp(k=0.3),p=1,                    control = list(tol = 0.001,                                   algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"),                                   algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),                                   Maxiter1 = 20,                                   Maxiter2 = 25),                    lam=c(10)) summary(mod1) #>  --------------------------------------------------------------- #>  Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors  #>  --------------------------------------------------------------- #>  Sample size:  142  #>  -------------------------- Model --------------------------- #>  #> aplms::aplms(formula = temperature ~ 1, npc = c("time"), basis = c("cr"),  #>     Knot = c(60), data = datos, family = Powerexp(k = 0.3), p = 1,  #>     control = list(tol = 0.001, algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"), algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),  #>         Maxiter1 = 20, Maxiter2 = 25), lam = c(10)) #>   #>  ------------------- Parametric component ------------------- #>  #>           Estimate Std. Error t value  Pr(>|t|)     #> intercept 0.056619     0.0041 13.8905 < 2.2e-16 *** #>  #>  ----------------- Non-parametric component ------------------  #>  #>          Wald       df    Pr(>.)     #> time 7589.838   58.583 < 2.2e-16 *** #>  #>  --------------- Autoregressive and Scale parameter ----------------  #>  #>        Estimate Std. Error    Wald  Pr(>|t|)     #> phi   0.0022992     0.0003  7.3902 1.242e-11 *** #> rho1 -0.2571215     0.0662 -3.8866 0.0001568 *** #>   #>  #> ------ Penalized Log-likelihood and Information criterion------ #>  #>  Log-lik:  200.07  #>  AIC    :  -276.97  #>  AICc   :  -274.46  #>  BIC    :  -94.94  #>  GCV    :  0.01  #>  #>  -------------------------------------------------------------------- plot(mod1) aplms.diag.plot(mod1) influenceplot.aplms(mod1,  perturbation = c("case-weight"))

title: Additive Partial Linear Models with Symmetric Autoregressive Errors
text: second dataset hospitalization:  perform diagnostic influence analyses, execute:
code: data(hospitalization)  mod2<-aplms::aplms(formula = y ~                MP10_avg + NO_avg + O3_avg + TEMP_min + ampl_max + RH_max,             npc=c("tdate","epi.week"), basis=c("cr","cc"),Knot=c(60,12),             data=hospitalization,family=Powerexp(k=0.3),p=3,             control = list(tol = 0.001,                            algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"),                            algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),                            Maxiter1 = 20,                            Maxiter2 = 25),             lam=c(100,10)) summary(mod2) #>  --------------------------------------------------------------- #>  Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors  #>  --------------------------------------------------------------- #>  Sample size:  932  #>  -------------------------- Model --------------------------- #>  #> aplms::aplms(formula = y ~ MP10_avg + NO_avg + O3_avg + TEMP_min +  #>     ampl_max + RH_max, npc = c("tdate", "epi.week"), basis = c("cr",  #>     "cc"), Knot = c(60, 12), data = hospitalization, family = Powerexp(k = 0.3),  #>     p = 3, control = list(tol = 0.001, algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"),  #>         algorithm2 = c("BFGS"), Maxiter1 = 20, Maxiter2 = 25),  #>     lam = c(100, 10)) #>   #>  ------------------- Parametric component ------------------- #>  #>            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> intercept 83.317951    14.8082  5.6265 2.44e-08 *** #> MP10_avg   0.276500     0.0673  4.1057 4.39e-05 *** #> NO_avg    -0.071118     0.0909 -0.7821   0.4344     #> O3_avg    -0.050675     0.0632 -0.8014   0.4231     #> TEMP_min   0.073164     0.2201  0.3324   0.7397     #> ampl_max  -0.174587     0.2640 -0.6613   0.5086     #> RH_max    -0.071845     0.1382 -0.5199   0.6032     #>  #>  ----------------- Non-parametric component ------------------  #>  #>             Wald      df    Pr(>.)     #> tdate    13.8541  3.5398  0.005221 **  #> epi.week 16.9563  1.5178 9.978e-05 *** #>  #>  --------------- Autoregressive and Scale parameter ----------------  #>  #>      Estimate Std. Error    Wald  Pr(>|t|)     #> phi  96.19593     5.0808 18.9331 < 2.2e-16 *** #> rho1  0.45783     0.0318 14.4155 < 2.2e-16 *** #> rho2  0.23190     0.0345  6.7186 3.211e-11 *** #> rho3  0.16820     0.0323  5.2017 2.434e-07 *** #>   #>  #> ------ Penalized Log-likelihood and Information criterion------ #>  #>  Log-lik:  -3706.73  #>  AIC    :  7445.58  #>  AICc   :  7446.61  #>  BIC    :  7523.26  #>  GCV    :  99.57  #>  #>  -------------------------------------------------------------------- plot(mod2) aplms.diag.plot(mod2) influenceplot.aplms(mod2,  perturbation = c("case-weight"))

title: Akaike information criterion — AIC.aplms
text: Print AIC fitted APLMS model.

title: Akaike information criterion — AIC.aplms
code: # S3 method for class 'aplms' AIC(object, ...)

title: Akaike information criterion — AIC.aplms
text: object APLMS object. ... arguments

title: Akaike information criterion — AIC.aplms
text: numeric value corresponding AIC.

title: Akaike information criterion — AIC.aplms
code: # \donttest{ data(temperature) datos = data.frame(temperature,time=1:length(temperature)) mod<-aplms::aplms(temperature ~ 1,                    npc=c("time"), basis=c("cr"),Knot=c(60),                    data=datos,family=Powerexp(k=0.3),p=1,                    control = list(tol = 0.001,                                   algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"),                                   algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),                                   Maxiter1 = 20,                                   Maxiter2 = 25),                    lam=c(10)) #> Iteration 1  #> Iteration 1 - 1  #> Iteration 1 - 2  #> Iteration 1 - 3  #> Iteration 1 - 4  #> Iteration 1 - 5  #> Iteration 1 - 6  #> Iteration 1 - 7  #> Iteration 2  #> Iteration 2 - 1  #> Iteration 2 - 2  #> Iteration 2 - 3  #> Iteration 2 - 4  #> Iteration 2 - 5  #> Iteration 2 - 6  #> Iteration 3  #> Iteration 3 - 1  #> Iteration 3 - 2  #> Iteration 3 - 3  #> Iteration 4  #> Iteration 4 - 1  AIC(mod) #> [1] -276.9661 # }

what: Diagnostic Plots for additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms.diag.plot
title: Diagnostic Plots for additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms.diag.plot
text: Diagnostic Plots additive partial linear models symmetric errors

title: Diagnostic Plots for additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms.diag.plot
code: aplms.diag.plot(model, which, labels = NULL, iden = F, ...)

title: Diagnostic Plots for additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms.diag.plot
text: model object result fitting additive partial linear models symmetric errors. optional numeric value number plot must returned. labels optional string vector specifying labels plots. iden logical value used identify observations. TRUE observations identified user graphic window. ... graphics parameters passed plotting routines.

title: Diagnostic Plots for additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms.diag.plot
text: Return interactive menu eleven options make plots. menu contains follows graphics: 1: Response residuals fited values. 2: Response residuals time index. 3: Histogram Response residuals. 4: Autocorrelation function response residuals. 5: Partial autocorrelation function response residuals. 6: Conditional quantile residuals fited values. 7: Conditional quantile residuals time index. 8: Histogram conditional quantile residuals. 9: Autocorrelation function conditional quantile residual. 10: Partial autocorrelation function conditional quantile residuals. 11: QQ-plot conditional quantile residuals.

title: Diagnostic Plots for additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms.diag.plot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(temperature) datos = data.frame(temperature,time=1:length(temperature)) mod1<-aplms::aplms(temperature ~ 1,                    npc=c("time"), basis=c("cr"),Knot=c(60),                    data=datos,family=Powerexp(k=0.3),p=1,                    control = list(tol = 0.001,                                   algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"),                                   algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),                                   Maxiter1 = 20,                                   Maxiter2 = 25),                    lam=c(10)) aplms.diag.plot(mod1, perturbation = c("case-weight")) } # }

what: Fitting Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms
title: Fitting Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms
text: aplms fits additive partial linear models autoregressive symmetric errors. method suitable data sets response variable continuous symmetric, either heavy light tails, measured time. model includes parametric component set covariates, another set covariates can specified semi-parametric functions, typically time-related. setup, natural cubic splines cubic P-splines used approximate nonparametric components.

title: Fitting Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms
code: aplms(   formula,   npc,   basis,   Knot,   data,   family = Normal(),   p = 1,   control = list(tol = 0.001, algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"), algorithm2 = c("BFGS"), Maxiter1 =     20, Maxiter2 = 25),   init,   lam )  # S3 method for class 'aplms' print(x, ...)

title: Fitting Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms
text: formula symbolic description parametric component model fitted. details model specification given ‘Details’. npc vector names non parametric component. basis vector names basis used non parametric covariate. Knot vector number knots non-linear component model. data data frame containing variables model family Symmetric error distribution. implemented distribution : Normal(), LogisI(), LogisII(), Student(df), Powerexp(k), Gstudent(parm=c(s,r)). p autoregressive order error control optimization rutine. init list initial values symmetric error scale, phi, autoregressive coefficients, rhos. lam smoothing parameter vector. x APLMS object. ... arguments

title: Fitting Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms
text: Returns object class “aplms”, list following components. formula formula object used. family family object used. npc npc object used. Knot Knot object used. lam lam object used. rdf Degrees freedom: n - q - p - 1. VAR_F Estimate asymptotic covariance matrix gamma parameters. basis basis used non parametric covariate. WALD_f summary table Wald statistics. summary_table_phirho summary table rho phi parameters. N_i Basis functions. f Estimated gamma parameters. Dv Dv values symmetric error. Dm Dm values symmetric error. Dc Dc values symmetric error. Dd Dd values symmetric error. delta delta_i symmetric error. LL_obs Observed information matrix fitted model. loglike estimated loglikelihood function fitted model. total_df total effective degree freedom model. parametric_df degree freedom parametric components. npc_df effective degree freedom non parametric components. AIC Akaike information criterion estimated model. BIC Bayesian information criterion estimated model. AICC Corrected Akaike information criterion estimated model. GCV generalized cross-validation (GCV). yhat fitted response values model. muhat fitted mean values model. residuals_y response residuals residuals_mu Raw (Ordinary) residuals: \(y_t - (\textbf{x}_i^\top\beta + f_1(t_{i1}) + \ldots + f_k(t_{ik}))\) data data object used. .call function call used.

title: Fitting Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms
text: Chou-Chen, S.W., Oliveira, R.., Raicher, ., Gilberto . Paula (2024)    Additive partial linear models autoregressive symmetric errors application    hospitalizations respiratory diseases Stat Papers 65, 5145–5166. doi:10.1007/s00362-024-01590-w Oliveira, R.., Paula, G.. (2021)    Additive partial linear models autoregressive symmetric errors application    hospitalizations respiratory diseases Comput Stat 36, 2435–2466. doi:10.1007/s00180-021-01106-2

title: Fitting Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors — aplms
code: data(temperature) datos = data.frame(temperature,time=1:length(temperature)) mod1<-aplms::aplms(temperature ~ 1,                    npc=c("time"), basis=c("cr"),Knot=c(60),                    data=datos,family=Powerexp(k=0.3),p=1,                    control = list(tol = 0.001,                                   algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"),                                   algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),                                   Maxiter1 = 20,                                   Maxiter2 = 25),                    lam=c(10)) #> Iteration 1  #> Iteration 1 - 1  #> Iteration 1 - 2  #> Iteration 1 - 3  #> Iteration 1 - 4  #> Iteration 1 - 5  #> Iteration 1 - 6  #> Iteration 1 - 7  #> Iteration 2  #> Iteration 2 - 1  #> Iteration 2 - 2  #> Iteration 2 - 3  #> Iteration 2 - 4  #> Iteration 2 - 5  #> Iteration 2 - 6  #> Iteration 3  #> Iteration 3 - 1  #> Iteration 3 - 2  #> Iteration 3 - 3  #> Iteration 4  #> Iteration 4 - 1  summary(mod1) #>  --------------------------------------------------------------- #>  Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors  #>  --------------------------------------------------------------- #>  Sample size:  142  #>  -------------------------- Model --------------------------- #>  #> aplms::aplms(formula = temperature ~ 1, npc = c("time"), basis = c("cr"),  #>     Knot = c(60), data = datos, family = Powerexp(k = 0.3), p = 1,  #>     control = list(tol = 0.001, algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"), algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),  #>         Maxiter1 = 20, Maxiter2 = 25), lam = c(10)) #>   #>  ------------------- Parametric component ------------------- #>  #>           Estimate Std. Error t value  Pr(>|t|)     #> intercept 0.056619     0.0041 13.8905 < 2.2e-16 *** #>  #>  ----------------- Non-parametric component ------------------  #>  #>          Wald       df    Pr(>.)     #> time 7589.838   58.583 < 2.2e-16 *** #>  #>  --------------- Autoregressive and Scale parameter ----------------  #>  #>        Estimate Std. Error    Wald  Pr(>|t|)     #> phi   0.0022992     0.0003  7.3902 1.242e-11 *** #> rho1 -0.2571215     0.0662 -3.8866 0.0001568 *** #>   #>  #> ------ Penalized Log-likelihood and Information criterion------ #>  #>  Log-lik:  200.07  #>  AIC    :  -276.97  #>  AICc   :  -274.46  #>  BIC    :  -94.94  #>  GCV    :  0.01  #>  #>  -------------------------------------------------------------------- print(mod1) #> Call: #> aplms::aplms(formula = temperature ~ 1, npc = c("time"), basis = c("cr"),  #>     Knot = c(60), data = datos, family = Powerexp(k = 0.3), p = 1,  #>     control = list(tol = 0.001, algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"), algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),  #>         Maxiter1 = 20, Maxiter2 = 25), lam = c(10))

what: Family Objects for Elliptical Models — family.elliptical
title: Family Objects for Elliptical Models — family.elliptical
text: family object provide specify details model APLMS. distribution functions necessary specify random component regression models elliptical errors. code derived archived package gwer (Araujo, Y.., Cysneiros, F.J.., Cysneiros, .H.M.., 2022), originally available CRAN.

title: Family Objects for Elliptical Models — family.elliptical
code: # S3 method for class 'elliptical' family(object, ...)  Normal()  Cauchy()  LogisI()  LogisII()  Student(df = stop("no df argument"))  Powerexp(k = stop("no k argument"))  Glogis(parma = stop("no alpha=alpha(m) or m argument"))  Gstudent(parm = stop("no s or r argument"))  Cnormal(parmt = stop("no epsi or sigma argument"))  GNormal(nu = stop("no nu argument"))

title: Family Objects for Elliptical Models — family.elliptical
text: object object result fitted elliptical regression model. ... arguments used form default control argument supplied directly. df degrees freedom. k shape parameter. parma parameter vector (alpha, m). parm parameter vector (s, r) distribuition. parmt parameters vector (epsi, sigma). nu degrees freedom.

title: Family Objects for Elliptical Models — family.elliptical
text: object class “family” specifying list follows elements: family character: family name. g0, g1, g2, g3, g4, g5 derived fuctions associated distribution family defined. df degree freedom t-Student distribution. s, r shape parameters generalized t-Student distribution. alpha shape parameter contaminated normal generalized logistic distributions. mp shape parameter generalized logistic distribution. epsi,sigmap dispersion parameters contaminated normal distribution. k shape parameter power exponential distribution.

title: Family Objects for Elliptical Models — family.elliptical
text: Fang, K. T., Kotz, S. NG, K. W. (1990, ISBN:9781315897943). Symmetric Multivariate Related Distributions. London: Chapman Hall.

title: Family Objects for Elliptical Models — family.elliptical
code: Normal() #>  #>  Normal family #>  #>  density  :    log(1/(sqrt(2 * pi)) * exp(-0.5 * z^2))  #>  #>  Wg:    rep(-0.5, length(z))  #>  #>  scale:    1/4  #>  #>  scale dispersion:    3/4  #>  #>  scale variance:    1  #>  #>  Wg':    rep(0, length(z))  Powerexp(k=0.1) #>  #>  Powerexp family #>  #>  density  :     log(1/(gamma(1 + ((1 + k)/2)) * 2^(1 + (1 + k)/2)) * exp(-0.5 * (abs(z)^(2/(1 + k)))))  #>  #>  Wg:     1/(-2 * (1 + k) * (z^2)^(k/(1 + k)))  #>  #>  scale:     (gamma((3 - k)/2))/(4 * (2^(k - 1) * (1 + k)^2 * gamma((k + 1)/2)))  #>  #>  scale dispersion:     (k + 3)/(4 * (k + 1))  #>  #>  scale variance:     2^(1 + k) * (gamma(1.5 * (k + 1))/(gamma((k + 1)/2)))  #>  #>  Wg':     k/(2 * (z^2)^((2 * k + 1)/(1 + k)) * ((1 + k)^2))  #>  #>  k  : 0.1

title: Respiratory diseases hospitalization Dataset — hospitalization
text: dataset consists respiratory diseases hospitalization Sorocaba, São Paulo, Brazil. details statistical modeling using APLMS-AR(p) approach can found Chou-Chen, et al. (2024). doi:10.1007/s00362-024-01590-w . hospitalization data respiratory diseases Sorocaba city, São Paulo, Brazil obtained Hospital Information System Brazil’s Unified National Health System (SIH-SUS), climatic pollution data provided QUALAR system.

title: Respiratory diseases hospitalization Dataset — hospitalization
code: data(hospitalization)

title: Respiratory diseases hospitalization Dataset — hospitalization
text: "data" slot data frame 932 weekly data following 29 variables. date, year, epi.week, tdate Date, year, epidemiologic weeks, time index. y Respiratory hospitalization count. MP10_max, MP10_min, MP10_avg Maximum, minimum average \(MP10\). NO_max,NO_min,NO_avg Maximum, minimum average \(\). NO2_max, NO2_min, NO2_avg Maximum, minimum average \(NO_2\). NOx_max, NOx_min, NOx_avg Maximum, minimum average \(NO_x\). O3_max, O3_min, O3_avg Maximum, minimum average \(O_3\). TEMP_max, TEMP_min, TEMP_avg Maximum, minimum average temperature. RH_max, RH_min, RH_avg Maximum, minimum average relative humidity. ampl_max, ampl_min, ampl_avg Maximum, minimum average daily temperature amplitude.

title: Respiratory diseases hospitalization Dataset — hospitalization
text: Chou-Chen, S.W., Oliveira, R.., Raicher, . et al. (2024) Additive partial linear models autoregressive symmetric errors application hospitalizations respiratory diseases. Stat Papers 65, 5145–5166. doi:10.1007/s00362-024-01590-w

what: local influence analysis of the object `aplms()` — influence.aplms
title: local influence analysis of the object `aplms()` — influence.aplms
text: Takes fitted `aplms` object outputs diagnostic information fitting procedure results. Returns conformal normal curvature fitted `aplms` model object. `case-weight`, `dispersion`, `response`, `explanatory`, `corAR` perturbations available.

title: local influence analysis of the object `aplms()` — influence.aplms
code: # S3 method for class 'aplms' influence(   model,   perturbation = c("case-weight", "dispersion", "response", "explanatory", "corAR"),   part = TRUE,   ... )

title: local influence analysis of the object `aplms()` — influence.aplms
text: model object result fitting additive partial linear models symmetric errors. perturbation string vector specifying perturbation scheme: `case-weight`, `dispersion`, `response`, `explanatory`, `corAR`. part logical value indicate whether influential analysis performed \(\gamma\), \(\phi\) \(\rho\). ... arguments.

title: local influence analysis of the object `aplms()` — influence.aplms
text: list object containing conformal normal curvature specified perturbations.

title: local influence analysis of the object `aplms()` — influence.aplms
code: if (FALSE) influence(model) # \dontrun{}

what: Local influence plots of the object `aplms()` — influenceplot.aplms
title: Local influence plots of the object `aplms()` — influenceplot.aplms
text: Takes fitted `aplms` object outputs diagnostics sensitivity analysis assessing effects perturbations model /data, parameter estimates. `case-weight`, `dispersion`, `response`, `explanatory`, `corAR` perturbations available.

title: Local influence plots of the object `aplms()` — influenceplot.aplms
code: influenceplot.aplms(   model,   perturbation = c("case-weight", "dispersion", "response", "explanatory", "corAR"),   part = TRUE,   C = 4,   labels = NULL )

title: Local influence plots of the object `aplms()` — influenceplot.aplms
text: model object result fitting additive partial linear models symmetric errors. perturbation string vector specifying perturbation scheme: `case-weight`, `dispersion`, `response`, `explanatory`, `corAR`. part logical value indicate whether influential analysis performed \(\gamma\), \(\phi\) \(\rho\). C cutoff criterion \(C_i > \bar{C_i} + C*sd(C_i)\) detect influential observations. labels label especify data point.

title: Local influence plots of the object `aplms()` — influenceplot.aplms
text: conformal normal curvature specified perturbations plotted.

title: Local influence plots of the object `aplms()` — influenceplot.aplms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(temperature) datos = data.frame(temperature,time=1:length(temperature)) mod1<-aplms::aplms(temperature ~ 1,                    npc=c("time"), basis=c("cr"),Knot=c(60),                    data=datos,family=Powerexp(k=0.3),p=1,                    control = list(tol = 0.001,                                   algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"),                                   algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),                                   Maxiter1 = 20,                                   Maxiter2 = 25),                    lam=c(10)) influenceplot.aplms(mod1, perturbation = c("case-weight")) } # }

title: Print method for
code: data(temperature) datos = data.frame(temperature,time=1:length(temperature)) mod<-aplms::aplms(temperature ~ 1,                    npc=c("time"), basis=c("cr"),Knot=c(60),                    data=datos,family=Powerexp(k=0.3),p=1,                    control = list(tol = 0.001,                                   algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"),                                   algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),                                   Maxiter1 = 20,                                   Maxiter2 = 25),                    lam=c(10)) #> Iteration 1  #> Iteration 1 - 1  #> Iteration 1 - 2  #> Iteration 1 - 3  #> Iteration 1 - 4  #> Iteration 1 - 5  #> Iteration 1 - 6  #> Iteration 1 - 7  #> Iteration 2  #> Iteration 2 - 1  #> Iteration 2 - 2  #> Iteration 2 - 3  #> Iteration 2 - 4  #> Iteration 2 - 5  #> Iteration 2 - 6  #> Iteration 3  #> Iteration 3 - 1  #> Iteration 3 - 2  #> Iteration 3 - 3  #> Iteration 4  #> Iteration 4 - 1  summary(mod) #>  --------------------------------------------------------------- #>  Additive partial linear models with symmetric errors  #>  --------------------------------------------------------------- #>  Sample size:  142  #>  -------------------------- Model --------------------------- #>  #> aplms::aplms(formula = temperature ~ 1, npc = c("time"), basis = c("cr"),  #>     Knot = c(60), data = datos, family = Powerexp(k = 0.3), p = 1,  #>     control = list(tol = 0.001, algorithm1 = c("P-GAM"), algorithm2 = c("BFGS"),  #>         Maxiter1 = 20, Maxiter2 = 25), lam = c(10)) #>   #>  ------------------- Parametric component ------------------- #>  #>           Estimate Std. Error t value  Pr(>|t|)     #> intercept 0.056619     0.0041 13.8905 < 2.2e-16 *** #>  #>  ----------------- Non-parametric component ------------------  #>  #>          Wald       df    Pr(>.)     #> time 7589.838   58.583 < 2.2e-16 *** #>  #>  --------------- Autoregressive and Scale parameter ----------------  #>  #>        Estimate Std. Error    Wald  Pr(>|t|)     #> phi   0.0022992     0.0003  7.3902 1.242e-11 *** #> rho1 -0.2571215     0.0662 -3.8866 0.0001568 *** #>   #>  #> ------ Penalized Log-likelihood and Information criterion------ #>  #>  Log-lik:  200.07  #>  AIC    :  -276.97  #>  AICc   :  -274.46  #>  BIC    :  -94.94  #>  GCV    :  0.01  #>  #>  --------------------------------------------------------------------
